item.title: Winter stroke alert: Why cold weather spikes your risk of a brain attack, prevention tips - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Winter stroke crisis: How to spot, treat and prevent the silent killer i.e. brain attack in cold weather.

Date: Dec 30, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

As winter brings colder temperatures, the risk of strokes increases due to various physiological and behavioral factors, including dehydration and inactivity. Dr. Neeraj Singh shares critical insights on identifying stroke symptoms and the importance of timely treatment.

  • Cold weather can increase blood pressure as blood vessels constrict to conserve heat.
  • Dehydration caused by reduced water intake raises blood viscosity, increasing stroke risk.
  • Symptoms of a stroke follow the BEFAST acronym: Balance, Eyes, Face Drooping, Arm Weakness, Speech Difficulty, and Time.
  • Immediate response is crucial to prevent lasting damage and complications.
  • Preventive measures include monitoring blood pressure, staying hydrated, and managing diet and exercise.
“The increased prevalence of strokes during winter can be because of physiological, environmental and behavioural factors.” - Dr. Neeraj Singh

Overall, it is vital to take proactive steps during winter to mitigate the risk of strokes and ensure a prompt response to symptoms.

item.title: Study of matrix modifications by nano-clay on the mechanical properties of AA3003 honeycomb sandwich panels - Amrita Vishwa Vidyapeetham
item.description:
Boosting AA3003 Honeycomb Sandwich Panels' Strength with Nano-Clay

Date & Source: Published in 2022 in the Proceedings of the Institution of Mechanical Engineers, Part C: Journal of Mechanical Engineering Science.

Introduction: Researchers from Amrita Vishwa Vidyapeetham explored the use of nano-clay to enhance the mechanical properties of AA3003 aluminum honeycomb sandwich panels.

  • Face/core debonding, a common issue, was addressed by adding nano-clay to the composite at varying concentrations (0%, 2%, 4%, and 6%).
  • The study found significant improvements in mechanical characteristics at nano-clay concentrations between 2% and 4%.
  • In-plane compression and flexural failure loads increased by 45% and 81%, respectively, compared to a pristine sample.
  • Higher strain rates led to increased failure loads.
  • Scanning electron microscope (SEM) images showed better adhesion between the aluminum honeycomb core and face sheets.

Conclusion: The addition of nano-clay, particularly at concentrations between 2% and 4%, can substantially enhance the mechanical properties of AA3003 honeycomb sandwich panels.

item.title: Single cigarette cuts 20 minutes from life expectancy, study reveals - WION
item.description:
Single Cigarette Cuts 20 Minutes from Life Expectancy, Study Reveals

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: The Guardian

A recent study conducted by University College London has highlighted the devastating effects of cigarette smoking, revealing that a single cigarette can reduce life expectancy by approximately 20 minutes. With an average pack of 20 cigarettes potentially cutting nearly seven hours off a smoker's life.

  • The study combines data from the British Doctors Study and the Million Women Study.
  • Smoking contributes to around 80,000 deaths annually in the UK.
  • The research emphasizes that smoking is the leading preventable cause of death and disease.
  • Supports available for smokers include the NHS Quit Smoking app and personalized plans.
“Every cigarette smoked costs precious minutes of life.” - Prof. Sanjay Agrawal

This research serves as a powerful reminder of the urgent need to address cigarette smoking, which has significant implications for health and the economy.

item.title: From smog to stroke: How does air quality affect cardiovascular health? - APN News
item.description:
Air Pollution's Hidden Threat: How it Affects Cardiovascular Health

Date & Source: December 2024, APN News

Introduction: Cardiovascular health is under threat from environmental factors, with air pollution being a significant concern. This article explores how air pollution contributes to heart-related issues, including strokes and heart attacks.

  1. Air pollution, particularly fine particulate matter (PM2.5), triggers inflammation, oxidative stress, and vascular dysfunction.
  2. Long-term exposure to polluted air can lead to atherosclerosis, increasing the risk of heart attacks and strokes.
  3. The elderly, individuals with pre-existing health conditions, and urban residents are most vulnerable.
  4. Air pollution increases the risk of both ischemic and hemorrhagic strokes.
  5. Preventative measures include using air quality apps, air purifiers, and maintaining a healthy lifestyle.
Improving air quality significantly reduces the risk of preventable cardiovascular diseases.

Conclusion: Addressing air pollution is crucial for promoting public health and reducing cardiovascular risks.

item.title: Important Blood Tests During Winter: 6 Key Screenings to Stay Healthy in Cold Weather - TheHealthSite
item.description:
Essential Blood Tests for Winter Health

Published on December 12, 2024, by The Health Site

Winter increases the risk of frequent illnesses, making it crucial to take proactive health steps. This article highlights the importance of blood tests during winter to detect underlying health issues early. It lists six key blood tests: complete blood count (CBC), vitamin D deficiency test, tests for joint and bone issues, ECG or stress test for cardiac problems, cardiac screening, and allergy tests for those prone to allergies.

  1. Complete blood count (CBC) to detect viral infections
  2. Vitamin D deficiency test due to reduced sunlight exposure
  3. Inflammatory markers test for joint and bone issues
  4. ECG or stress test for cardiac problems
  5. Regular cardiac screening
  6. Allergy tests for allergy-prone individuals

Tips to stay healthy during winter include staying hydrated, eating balanced meals, dressing appropriately, washing hands frequently, using a humidifier, staying active, not ignoring health issues, and scheduling regular health checkups.

item.title: Guilty Of The Festive Binge? Try These 10 Ways To Detox In The New Year - Slurrp
item.description:
Guilty Of The Festive Binge? Try These 10 Ways To Detox In The New Year

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Slurrp

The festive season often leads to overindulgence, leaving us bloated and lethargic. A thoughtful detox can help restore balance and rejuvenate your body. Here are effective ways to detox after the festive binge.

  • Hydrate adequately with water and herbal teas.
  • Incorporate fresh fruits, vegetables, and whole grains into your meals.
  • Engage in gentle exercises like yoga or walking.
  • Prioritize quality sleep to aid detoxification.
  • Avoid processed foods and limit caffeine and alcohol.
  • Practice mindful eating habits.
  • Focus on whole, plant-based foods for nourishment.
  • Include detoxifying beverages in your diet.
  • Engage in regular physical activity to boost detox processes.
  • Prioritize gut health with probiotics and prebiotics.
"Detoxing helps reset your system, restore energy levels, and improve overall health." - Article Source

This detox period is a chance for rejuvenation. By nourishing your body and being mindful of your habits, you can regain vitality and embrace the New Year positively.

item.title: 5 essential tips for parents to take of their babies during winter - Health shots
item.description:
5 Essential Tips for Parents to Care for Babies During Winter

Published On: 30 Dec 2024, 12:06 pm IST

Winter can be a cozy time for families, but it can also bring extra challenges for babies. The cold weather can affect their health in various ways, necessitating extra precautions to keep them safe and healthy.

Key Points:

  • Keep the baby warm by dressing them appropriately in woolen clothing.
  • Protect the baby’s skin from dryness with chemical-free moisturizers.
  • Monitor their breathing pattern to prevent respiratory problems.
  • Regularly massage the baby for improved circulation and hydration.
  • Avoid overheating by dressing them appropriately for the temperature.

Conclusion:

These tips can help ensure your baby remains healthy during winter, but consulting a doctor is always a good practice.

item.title: Ageing fine: 10 healthy meal planning tips for better health, nutrition - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Ageing fine: 10 healthy meal planning tips for better health, nutrition

Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: Moneycontrol

This article provides ten essential meal planning tips to help individuals maintain better health and nutrition as they age.

  • Enjoy diverse foods to minimise disease risks like diabetes and hypertension with colourful fruits and vegetables.
  • Prioritise protein-rich foods to maintain muscle strength.
  • Include fruits and vegetables in meals and snacks for fiber and vitamins.
  • Ensure adequate B12 intake through fortified foods or supplements.
  • Season meals with herbs and citrus instead of salt to reduce sodium.
  • Opt for unsaturated fats like olive oil or avocados over saturated fats.
  • Stay hydrated to support digestion and nutrient absorption.
  • Choose whole grains for sustained energy and fiber.
  • Include calcium-rich foods like dairy or fortified non-dairy products.
  • Maintain appropriate portion sizes to manage calorie intake.

item.title: 9 mental health habits you should adopt for a healthier 2025 - Moneycontrol
item.description:
9 Mental Health Habits You Should Adopt Now for a Healthier 2025

Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: Moneycontrol

This article outlines essential mental health habits to incorporate now to improve well-being by 2025.

  • Exercise: A 30-minute daily walk can reduce anxiety and promote good sleep by releasing endorphins.
  • Proper Sleep: Consistently sticking to a sleep schedule can help manage stress and anxiety.
  • Drink Water: Staying hydrated boosts focus, reduces fatigue, and supports brain health.
  • Nutritious Meals: A balanced diet rich in fruits, vegetables, and proteins supports cognitive health.
  • Limit Caffeine and Alcohol: Moderation is key for mental health and wellness.
  • Relax: Practices like meditation and breathing exercises help reduce stress.
  • Set Goals: Setting achievable goals can help manage daily stress and prevent overwhelm.
  • Meet Family and Friends: Maintaining relationships provides emotional support and reduces feelings of isolation.
  • Gratitude: Writing down things you're grateful for can shift focus from stress to positivity.
“Gratitude shifts your focus from stress to positivity.”

In conclusion, adopting these mental health habits can pave the way for a healthier and happier 2025.

item.title: 10 health benefits of dark chocolate that will surprise you - Moneycontrol
item.description:
10 health benefits of dark chocolate that will surprise you

Publication Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: Moneycontrol

Dark chocolate is packed with powerful benefits. From improving heart health to managing weight, it’s good for your well-being.

  • Improves blood flow and lowers blood pressure.
  • Boosts insulin sensitivity, aiding in diabetes prevention.
  • Provides antioxidant protection, neutralizing free radicals.
  • Enhances cognitive function and memory.
  • Reduces inflammation and strengthens immunity.
  • Aids in weight control by suppressing appetite.
  • Provides sustained energy, making it a great pre-workout snack.
  • Promotes healthier skin, providing hydration and UV protection.
  • Strengthens bones and supports better calcium absorption.
“Dark chocolate is really good for your heart and can prevent diabetes.”

Incorporating dark chocolate into your diet can lead to notable health improvements, making it both a delicious and smart choice.
